data.event: Bradford became a municipal borough in 1847, and received its charter as a city in 1897.
Following local government reform in 1974, city status was bestowed upon the wider metropolitan borough.

event.title: forms part of the West Yorkshire Urban Area conurbation which in 2001

data.event: Bradford forms part of the West Yorkshire Urban Area conurbation which in 2001 had a population of 1.5 million and is the fourth largest urban area in the United Kingdom with the Bradford subdivision of the aforementioned urban area having a population of 528,155.
